x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Many elderly people in the UK live alone and face health or safety risks that often go unnoticed until too late. Traditional welfare checks rely on phone calls or in-person visits, which are time-consuming and inconsistent. There’s a need for an automated, proactive way to ensure seniors’ wellbeing and alert caregivers quickly in emergencies.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.project_name: Elder Care – Smart Welfare Check System for Seniors
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

Use ServiceNow Flow Designer to automate daily welfare check-ins via SMS or mobile app. Virtual Agent handles responses from seniors, while Case Management routes non-responses or distress signals to caregivers or local social care teams. A dashboard provides real-time status tracking for support staff.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

Integration with communication APIs like Twilio for SMS, and possibly smart home sensors or wearable health devices for passive monitoring.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Data privacy and security (handling sensitive personal data), ensuring seniors are comfortable using the system, and managing alerts effectively without overwhelming support staff.
